    • insert

      public void insert(A author)
      Inserts an author into the database.

      If the author's ID number is null, a unique ID is assigned to the author. If the author does not already exist in the database, the author is added.

      Specified by:
      insert in interface ManageAuthorsI<A extends Author>
      Parameters:
      author - the author to be inserted

    • update

      public void update(A author)
      Updates an existing author in the database.

      If the author exists in the database, the author's information is updated. If the author does not exist, no action is taken.

      Specified by:
      update in interface ManageAuthorsI<A extends Author>
      Parameters:
      author - the author to be updated

    • remove

      public void remove(A author, String fn)
      Removes an author from the system and logs the removal.

      This method performs the following actions: 1. Removes the author from the HashMap that maps user IDs to authors. 2. Adds the author's ID and name to another HashMap for tracking removed authors. 3. Logs the removal by writing the author's name to a specified text file. 4. Removes the author's papers from the system.

      Specified by:
      remove in interface ManageAuthorsI<A extends Author>
      Parameters:
      author - the author to be removed
      fn - the filename of the text file where the author's name will be logged

    • listAuthorsDeletedLog

      public void listAuthorsDeletedLog()
      Logs and prints a list of all deleted authors.

      Iterates through the map of removed authors and prints each author's ID and name.

    • listAuthors

      public ArrayList<Author> listAuthors()
      Lists all authors in the database.

      Iterates through the map of authors and collects them into an ArrayList.

      Specified by:
      listAuthors in interface ManageAuthorsI<A extends Author>
      Returns:
      a list of all authors

    • insert

      public void insert(P paper)
      Inserts a paper into the database.

      If the paper's DOI is null, a new DOI is generated and assigned to the paper. If the paper is a conference paper, "1" is appended to the DOI. If the paper is a journal paper, "0" is appended to the DOI. The paper is then added to the map of DOIs.

      Specified by:
      insert in interface ManagePapersI<A extends Author>
      Parameters:
      paper - the paper to be inserted

    • update

      public void update(P paper)
      Updates an existing paper in the database.

      If the paper exists in the database, the paper's information is updated. If the paper does not exist, no action is taken.

      Specified by:
      update in interface ManagePapersI<A extends Author>
      Parameters:
      paper - the paper to be updated

    • remove

      public void remove(P paper)
      Removes a paper from the database.

      The paper is removed from all authors who have written it. The paper is then removed from the map of DOIs.

      Specified by:
      remove in interface ManagePapersI<A extends Author>
      Parameters:
      paper - the paper to be removed

    • listPapers

      public ArrayList<String> listPapers()
      Lists all papers in the database.

      Iterates through the map of DOIs and collects the string representation of each paper into an ArrayList.

      Specified by:
      listPapers in interface ManagePapersI<A extends Author>
      Returns:
      a list of string representations of all papers

    • generateDoi

      public String generateDoi()
      Generates a unique DOI for a paper.

      Combines a timestamp with a random component to ensure uniqueness.

      Specified by:
      generateDoi in interface ManagePapersI<A extends Author>
      Returns:
      a newly generated unique DOI

    • paperAuthorByIdPeriodIn

      public ArrayList<String> paperAuthorByIdPeriodIn(Integer idAuthor, Date startDate, Date endDate)
      Time complexity: O(PlogP + M) Retrieves a list of paper titles for a specific author within a specified date range. Extra Space: O(N + Q) N = Number of authors with specified id Q = number of unique paper titles across all authors

      This method constructs a Red-Black Binary Search Tree (BST) of the author's papers, indexed by the year of publication. It then collects and returns the titles of the papers published within the given date range.

      Parameters:
      idAuthor - the unique identifier of the author
      startDate - the start date of the period (inclusive)
      endDate - the end date of the period (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a list of paper titles published by the author within the specified date range, or null if the author does not exist

    • paperAuthorByIdPeriodIn

      public void paperAuthorByIdPeriodIn(Integer idAuthor, Date startDate, Date endDate, String fn)
      Time complexity: O(PlogP + M) Retrieves a list of paper titles for a specific author within a specified date range and output to a txt file the result.

      This method constructs a Red-Black Binary Search Tree (BST) of the author's papers, indexed by the year of publication. It then collects and returns the titles of the papers published within the given date range.

      Parameters:
      idAuthor - the unique identifier of the author
      startDate - the start date of the period (inclusive)
      endDate - the end date of the period (inclusive)
      fn - the txt file name

    • paperAuthorByNamePeriod

      public ArrayList<String> paperAuthorByNamePeriod(String nameAuthor, Date startDate, Date endDate)
      Retrieves the titles of papers authored by authors with a given name within a specified time period. Time complexity: O(N + M * P + Q) Extra Space: O(N + Q) N = Number of authors with specified name Q = number of unique paper titles across all authors

      This method searches for all authors with the specified name and retrieves the papers authored by each of these authors within the specified time period. It then returns a list of unique paper titles authored by authors with the given name during the specified time period.

      Parameters:
      nameAuthor - the name of the author
      startDate - the start date of the time period
      endDate - the end date of the time period
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of unique paper titles authored by authors with the given name during the specified time period, or a list containing a message if there are no papers in the defined timestamp

    • paperAuthorByNamePeriod

      public void paperAuthorByNamePeriod(String nameAuthor, Date startDate, Date endDate, String fn)
      Retrieves the titles of papers authored by authors with a given name within a specified time period and output to a txt file. Time complexity: O(N + M * P + Q)

      This method searches for all authors with the specified name and retrieves the papers authored by each of these authors within the specified time period. It then returns a list of unique paper titles authored by authors with the given name during the specified time period.

      Parameters:
      nameAuthor - the name of the author
      startDate - the start date of the time period
      endDate - the end date of the time period
      fn - the txt file name to output result

    • top3PapersMostDownloads

      public Paper[] top3PapersMostDownloads()
      Retrieves the top 3 papers with the most downloads. Time complexity: O(NlogN) N = number of papers Extra Space: O(N) N = number of papers in DB

      This method retrieves all papers from the database and sorts them based on the number of downloads in descending order. It then selects the top 3 papers with the highest number of downloads and returns them in an array.

      Returns:
      an array of Paper objects containing the top 3 papers with the most downloads, or an array with fewer than 3 elements if there are fewer than 3 papers in the databas

    • top3PapersMostDownloads

      public void top3PapersMostDownloads(String fn)
      Retrieves the top 3 papers with the most downloads and output the result to a txt file.
      Parameters:
      fn - the txt file name to output result Time complexity: O(NlogN) N = number of papers

      This method retrieves all papers from the database and sorts them based on the number of downloads in descending order. It then selects the top 3 papers with the highest number of downloads and returns them in an array.

    • papersNotDownloadedNotViewed

      public ArrayList<String> papersNotDownloadedNotViewed()
      Retrieves a list of papers that have not been downloaded or viewed. Time complexity: O(N) N = number of papers inside HashMap Extra Space: O(N) N = number of papers in MapDOI

      This method traverses the `mapDOI` HashMap, which maps DOI (Digital Object Identifier) strings to `Paper` objects. It checks each paper to see if it has zero downloads and zero views. If both conditions are met, the paper is added to the returned list.

      Returns:
      an ArrayList of String title of the Papers that have not been downloaded or viewed

    • papersNotDownloadedNotViewed

      public void papersNotDownloadedNotViewed(String fn)
      Retrieves a list of papers that have not been downloaded or viewed and write the result to a txt file
      Parameters:
      fn - file name Time complexity: O(N) N = number of papers inside HashMap

      This method traverses the `mapDOI` HashMap, which maps DOI (Digital Object Identifier) strings to `Paper` objects. It checks each paper to see if it has zero downloads and zero views. If both conditions are met, the paper is added to the returned list.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
